comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Ok, that's not an option, but thanks for the info.  Are you, or are you not intentionally blocking **ad.doubleclick.net** though?  I'm not clear on what's happening, b/c Alex said "we have that opportunity. But it's not purposefully blocked."  If not, then how and why is it being blocked?  And is there no way for AG to unblock it then?

As I said above, _I don't want to remove AdGuard DNS servers just to be able to occasionally load this one domain. I'm not sure why you'd want to block it though, considering that so many Google ads rely on this to load their product links._

comment.body:
@peace2000 Can you try the following? This should get rid of their SSAI.

1. Remove any previous rules.
2. Add:
```
mtv.fi##+js(json-prune-fetch-response, playbackItem.isStitched, , propsToMatch, url:a2d.tv/play)
mtv.fi##+js(xml-prune, Ad, , /fwmrm.net\/ad\/g/)
```

Also make sure you try it with the default settings in uBO + your regional filter.

comment.body:
I don't have access to any live content, so I cannot check it out, but I see ads on "Freevee" if I disable `$replace` rules.
As I recall, this `$replace` rule from screenshot is required to fix issue with synchronization subtitles with movie and we have a scriptlet rule which do something similar, so it's probably causing this problem in Opera extension.
If live content has a different path with `.mdp` file than "Freevee", then we could try narrow down the path of the rule.
If not, then maybe content of the file is different and we could try modify a rule, so it wouldn't be applied to live content.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172033

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172033

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://6klabs.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2F6klabs.com%2F) ### Comment > After checking logs, I think Stealth Mode crashes some features of safe websites. 6klabs uses Spotify API to track which song you're listening right now, but it uses online API connected with Spotify Developer account, it doesn't access local data on pc. Last days more and more pages stop loading "Refused to connect". > > The funny thing is, disabling AdGuard protection with extension, inside app, from tray doesn't do anything, BUT when I completely exit AdGuard not leaving in working in background, all of the websites start working fine as they should. ### Screenshots

Last days more and more pages stop loading "Refused to connect". > > The funny thing is, disabling AdGuard protection with extension, inside app, from tray doesn't do anything, BUT when I completely exit AdGuard not leaving in working in background, all of the websites start working fine as they should. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
I think that in the case of the extension for Firefox, the problem is that JavaScript rules are blocked by website's Content Security Policy, related to - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2782 and https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/1733
As far as I can see, it should be fixed in 4.4 version.

comment.body:
@shape55 

> Are you, or are you not intentionally blocking **ad.doubleclick.net** though?

My mistake - we do not block `googleadservices.com` domain to avoid breakage links with tracking in the search results. It is not used to load ads. 
`ad.doubleclick.net` is blocked (used for loading ad/tracking resources).

pull_request.title: Remove JS rules used to set a cookie - 2024 Apr 17 part 1

issue.title: Getting rid of JS rules, used to set a cookie

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We have ~317 JS rules, used to set a cookie. They can be found by:
`document.cookie =`
They must be replaced by `set-cookie` / `set-cookie-reload` / `trusted-set-cookie-reload` scriptlet rules.

There are many old rules, so first you need to check if the site is available, and then the need for the rule.

* For convenience, you can work in a separate browser
* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

@bbsixzz We have `@@||meteoblue.com/build/website/gpt.js` in Annoyances/Popups filter. On my end it fixes the problem.

Please try to disable-enable content blockers in Safari settings and restart Safari, and check for filters update.
Do not close AdGuard window ~90 seconds, because iOS will breaks configuration process.

Also try to open `meteoblue.com/build/website/gpt.js` in Safari and tell us about result.

issue.title: Getting rid of clicking JS rules

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We have ~423 JS rules, used for clicking. They can be found by the regexp:
`#%#AG_onLoad.*\.click\(`
They must be replaced by [trusted-click-element](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/Scriptlets/blob/master/wiki/about-trusted-scriptlets.md#-%EF%B8%8F-trusted-click-element) scriptlet rules.

The most rules can be converted to one rule. If converted  into more than one rule - make groups for the sites in corresponding files as usual.
There are many old rules, so first you need to check if the site is available, and then the need for the rule.

* For convenience, you can work in a separate browser
* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

comment.body:
Okay, I have modified rules, so now these rules should be applied to `.mpd` files from `aiv-cdn.net`.
I hope that it will fix live content and ads still be blocked (I have tested it and on my end ads are blocked correctly).

comment.body:
I suppose that the problem is like mentioned in - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/176461#issuecomment-2044374109 and sometimes scriptlets are executed too late, but I cannot reproduce it with `cuervotv.me#%#//scriptlet('abort-on-property-read', 'HTMLIFrameElement.prototype.contentWindow')`.
Similar issue was here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/168535 and it was the same ad script, but on `ruyamanga.com` ads were displayed instead of popunders and adding a rule blocking ad servers fixed it.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172033

issue.title: using adguard mobile ads filter makes Facebook scroll jump back

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

none

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

m.facebook.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### Privacy

EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List

### Social Widgets

Fanboy's Social Blocking List

### Annoyances

AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, EasyList Cookie List

### Security

Online Malicious URL Blocklist

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

EasyList Italy

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Browser: Firefox mobile 124.2.0

Ublock origin version: 1.57.0

Android version: miui 14.0.13.0.TKOEUVF

Hello. While I scroll Facebook home in the browser often it goes back enough to send to the previous post I've seen. It does the reverse thing if I try to scroll back, jumping forth. Disabling adguard mobile ads filter this behaviour stops.

Looks like its related to ads not being shown but not correctly handled, I could be wrong though.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition
